refnamediv.refpurpose: Command to sent out digital signal to a connected Arduino board

listitem.para: Board pointer, to indicate which board to use to differentiate one board from another
Digital pin to sent the signal
The value of 0 or 1 to be sent to the digital pins with. It is correspond to 0 and 5V

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The Arduino board has a set of logical ports (digital) that are used for writing or reading data from a component.

To map a UNO, ports 2-13 are available (0 and 1 are used for serial transmission). For MEGA board, ports 2-53 are available. The port takes the low logic level (0) or logic high (1) which corresponds to the reference voltage.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: h = open_serial(1,9,115200) cmd_digital_out(h,13,0) sleep(1000) cmd_digital_out(h,13,1) sleep(1000) close_serial(h)
